medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 24 hours ago with lower back pain, followed 12 hours later by stabbing epigastric pain that progressed to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). The pain worsens when lying back and is relieved by keeping her knees up. It is non-radiating and not associated with nausea or vomiting, but the patient experienced 2 loose, non-bloody bowel movements. Denies fever or chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Juvenile myoclonic epilepsy, well controlled with Depakote, with the last seizure occurring several years ago.
